decision_conditions: The ivy is not covered by the TPO process, so permission is not required for this work, but it is noted that the ivy will be removed and severed from the Ash tree T12.

It is recommended that this Ash tree T12 as shown on the Havering TPO plan 32/04 can be overall crown reduced by up to 2m from the tip to an inter-nodal branch break to leave the tree balanced, to include removal of basal epicormic growth.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out to the standards detailed in British Standard Document BS 3998:2010.
To ensure that the work is carried out in accordance with good arboricultural practice.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out as an overall reduction, so that the tree's crown remains balanced.
To ensure that the tree's stability is maintained and in the interests of public amenity.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out within 2 years from the date of this consent.
To prevent the accumulation of consents.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description:
Rear Garden - Back Boundary Area. T1 - Ivy Clad Ash
Reduce length of all branches by 2 metres ensuring natural shape and balance typical of species is maintained where possible.
Remove Ivy leaf foliage retaining framework and sever at base, Remove basal and Epicormic growth.
The tree is located to the rear boundary adjacent to the boundary fence of 21 Merlin Gardens. Reduction works are part of a maintenance program to maintain the tree at a suitable size for its location leaving a finished height of approximately 10m and width of approximately 7-8m. To reduce the extent of the encroachment over all adjacent gardens. To allow more suitable light levels in to the rear garden and surrounding gardens. Removal of Ivy - Exempt works.
